introduction.p: Powers come before products in the order of operations, so to evaluate an exponential function f(x)=ab^x we evaluate b^x before multiplying by a.

solution.p:
Follow the order of operations: compute powers before products.
f(2)=8 \cdot 4^2 = 8\cdot 16 = 128
f(-2)=8 \cdot 4^{-2} = 8\cdot \dfrac{1}{16} = \dfrac{1}{2}
f\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)=8 \cdot 4^{1/2} = 8\cdot 2 = 16
f\left(-\frac{1}{2}\right)=8 \cdot 4^{-1/2} = 8\cdot \dfrac{1}{2} = 4

introduction.p: The definitions of the variables help us interpret function notation.

statement.p:
The number of students at Salt Creek Elementary School is growing according to the formula ~f(t)=500(1.08)^t~, where t is the number of years since the school opened in 2005.
What does the equation ~f(6)=500(1.08)^6~ tell us about the school?
Use function notation to say that the student population was 583 in 2007.

ol.label: a
ol.li: In this equation, t=6 and f(6)=793. In 2011 (six years after the school opened), the student population was 793.

statement.p:
The value of Digicorp stock has been falling according to the formula ~V(w)=48(0.96)^w~, where w is the number of weeks since its peak value of $48 per share.
Use function notation to say that 8 weeks later the value of a share of Digicorp stock was $34.63.
What does the equation ~V(12) = 48(0.96)^{12} = 29.41~ tell us about the stock?

ol.label: a
ol.li: We evaluate the function at w=8 to get ~V(8) = 48(0.96)^8 = 34.63.
In this equation, w=12 and V(12) = 29.41, so 12 weeks after the peak value a share of Digicorp stock was worth $29.41.

statement.p: The number of internet users in the United States is given by ~I(t) = 95,331,000(1.09)^t~, where t=0 in 2000. Use function notation to say that the number of internet users in 2005 was 146,679,000.

The percent of U.S. households that maintain a landline telephone is decreasing according to the formula ~L(t) = 95(0.96)^t~, where t=0 in 2004. What does the equation ~L(t) = 95(0.96)^{10} = 63~ tell us about landlines?

answer.p: In 2014, 63% of households maintained a landline.

introduction.p: We first solve equations graphically in Section 1.3, so you might want to review that section.

statement.p: Here is a graph of f(x)=x^2+2x-16. Use the graph to solve the equation x^2+2x-16=8. Show your work on the graph.

solution.p: To solve the equation, we want to find x-values that produce a function value of 8. The vertical coordinate of each point on the graph is given by the function value, f(x). So we look for points on the graph with vertical coordinate f(x)=8.

There are two such points, (-6,8) and (4,8). Those points tell us that f(-6)=8 and f(4)=8. Thus, the x-coordinates of the points, namely -6 and 4, are the solutions. To check algebraically, we can verify that f(-6)=8 and f(4)=8: f(\alert{-6}) \amp = (\alert{-6})^2+2(\alert{-6})-16 = 36-12-16 = 8 f(\alert{4})\amp = \alert{4}^2+2(\alert{4})-16 = 16+8-16 = 8

statement.p: Here is a graph of G(x)=\dfrac{20}{(x-3)^2}. Use the graph to solve the equation \dfrac{20}{(x-3)^2} = 5. Show your work on the graph.

sidebyside.p: We find any points on the graph with vertical coordinate G(x)=5. There are two points, (1,5) and (5,5.) The x-coordinates of those points, namely 1 and 5, are the solutions.
